definition: (honorific) revered news/the most valuable information (in your recent letter, book etc)/Thank you for your letter.

sentences.english: We hxdye the pleasure to acknowledge your fxdyour of yesterday advising 25 cases for Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 您昨日告知向上海發出25箱的信函我們已敬悉。

sentences.chinese: 您昨日告知向上海發出25箱的信函我們已敬悉。

sentences.english: We have received your letter of July 1, enquiring about the best terms of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 貴公司7月1日來函就該商品優惠條件的詢盤敬悉。

definition: to respectfully inform (used at the beginning or end of letters)
Dear Sirs/To Whom It May Concern
a telegraph condolence/to send a message of condolence by telegram
to handle in accordance with (the rules)
to do as one thinks fit/to handle by taking circumstances into consideration
incoming letter/letter from afar/same as 来信
